Path 1.name: Quad Darts
Path 1.description: Shoots 4 darts per volley instead of 2.
Path 1.effect: Self-explanatory

Path 1.name: Pursuit
Path 1.description: A new targeting option enables Heli to seek and pursue the Bloons automatically.
Path 1.effect: Heli pilot gains a new flight priority called pursuit, which goes in front of the bloon that is closest to the exit and attacks it. Targeting of the heli pilot will automatically change to pursuit when upgrade is bought.

Path 1.name: Razor Rotors
Path 1.description: Razor Rotor blades rip up Bloons on contact, including Lead and Frozen Bloons.
Path 1.effect: Gains razor rotors attack, which deals 2 damage every 0.45 seconds to 10 bloons within a close range of the Heli pilot. Razor rotors can pop Lead and Frozen bloons

Path 1.name: Apache Dartship
Path 1.description: Adds a large missile array and powerful machine guns.
Path 1.effect: Gains quad homing missiles that deal 2 damage individually. Also gains a dart-firing machine gun that shoots darts really fast. Improves razor rotors attack by doubling its damage from 2 to 4, and by doubling its pierce from 10 to 20.

Path 1.name: Apache Prime
Path 1.description: The Apache Prime leaves most Bloons wishing they'd never been inflated.
Path 1.effect: Qaud darts are replaced by powerful shots of lasers that deal 6 damage and have much more pierce. replaces machine gun with a plasma gun that deals 5 damage and has more pierce. Missiles now deal 17 damage to MOAB-Class bloons instead of 2 damage. Improves razor rotors again by doubling its damage from 4 to 8 and pierce from 20 to 40

Path 2.name: Bigger Jets
Path 2.description: Powerful jets make Heli move much faster.
Path 2.effect: Heli Pilot moves 75% faster with any targeting.

Path 2.name: IFR
Path 2.description: Allows Heli Pilot to detect and shoot Camo Bloons.
Path 2.effect: Allows the Heli Pilot to detect and attack Camo Bloons.

Path 2.name: Downdraft
Path 2.description: Blows Bloons away from the Heli, back toward the entrance.
Path 2.effect: Periodically blows bloons back up to a certain distance. Downdraft affects 2 bloons or 1 Ceramic at a time at a rate of 4.44 blowbacks per second. Downdraft can blow back bloons faster with faster firing.

Path 2.name: Support Chinook
Path 2.description: Blows back many more Bloon and gains abilities: Drops lives and cash crates, or can pick up and redeploy most Monkey types.
Path 2.effect: Heli Pilot gains two new abilities, the Support crate ability and the Redeployment ability. Crates give bonus lives and bonus cash (Amount of cash can be affected by cash buffs). Can redeploy all "non-heavy" types of tower. Blowback rate improved from 4.44 blowbacks per second to 6.67 blowbacks per second, and blowback pierce increased from 2 to 4. Heli Pilot's darts also are larger and deal 2 damage.

Path 2.name: Special Poperations
Path 2.description: Deploys a powerful special Monkey Marine with machine gun.
Path 2.effect:
Increases Heli Pilot's movement speed by 50%, lowers Support ability cooldown, alongside increasing the cash bonus, and gains another ability that deploys a powerful blue Marine that can see camo. The Marine uses a powerful machine gun that deals 6 damage, has 20 pierce, and pops any bloon type. The Marine's machine gun shoots faster with the Faster Firing upgrade. If
Door Gunner
Monkey Knowledge
is active, also gains the Doorgunner ability, which picks up a tower that is not heavy or a Tier 5 to fire from the Special Poperations Heli Pilot itself.

Path 3.name: Faster Darts
Path 3.description: Darts are propelled much faster through the air.
Path 3.effect: Improves projectile propel speed of the darts. Increases attack distance of the darts by 30%.

Path 3.name: Faster Firing
Path 3.description: Faster attack speed for all Heli attacks.
Path 3.effect: Improves Heli Pilot's attack speed by 25%.

Path 3.name: MOAB Shove
Path 3.description: Can collide with and shove MOAB-Class Bloons, reversing or slowing their movement. Shove is amplified by Bigger Jets and IFR upgrades.
Path 3.effect: Pushes MOAB-Class bloons that are close to it back or slows down their movement. Improves shove effect with the Bigger Jets upgrade. Also adds a new slow firing missile attack that deals 1 damage along with an additional 2 damage to Ceramic and MOAB-Class bloons and can pop lead.

Path 3.name: Comanche Defense
Path 3.description: Automatically calls in mini Comanches when they're most needed.
Path 3.effect: Heli Pilot gains the ability to summon Mini Comanches. The first Mini Comanche is summoned when bloons reach 25% of the track, another at 50%, and the last one at 75% of the track. Mini Comanches are considered as Sub-towers, so buffs only apply to the main Heli Pilot. Mini-Comanches shoot enhanced darts and missiles and automatically fly in the same flight pattern as main Heli Pilot. Main Heli's attacks are also improved.

Path 3.name: Comanche Commander
Path 3.description: Upgraded weapons. Also automatically calls in 3 more Comanches. Permanently.
Path 3.effect: Main Heli Pilot and Mini Comanches' darts' damage improved. Missiles deal much more damage along with even more bonuses towards MOAB-Class bloons and Ceramic bloons. The 3 Mini Comanches that used to come when bloons reached a certain percantage of the track are now permanent.

Mortar Monkey.name: Mortar Monkey
Mortar Monkey.cost: Cost Default: $640 (Easy) $750 (Medium) $810 (Hard) $900 (Impoppable) Advanced Logistics : $605 (Easy) $710 (Medium) $770 (Hard) $855 (Impoppable) Military Conscription : $425 (Easy) $500 (Medium) $545 (Hard) $605 (Impoppable) Both : $395 (Easy) $465 (Medium) $500 (Hard) $560 (Impoppable)
Mortar Monkey.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Artillery Battery Pop and Awe
Mortar Monkey.related_towers: Mortar Tower (BTD4) , for the BTD4 counterpart Mortar Tower (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Mortar Monkey (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Bigger Blast
Path 1.description: Bigger shells deliver a bigger blast radius.
Path 1.effect: Each explosion produces a large explosion radius (20 to 28), and increases main pierce from 25 to 45.

Path 1.name: Bloon Buster
Path 1.description: Smash through 3 layers of Bloon at once!
Path 1.effect: Explosions deal 3 damage instead of 2.

Path 1.name: Shell Shock
Path 1.description: Blast shockwave stuns bloons at impact, pops bloons in a wider area, and increases Burny Stuff damage.
Path 1.effect: Creates a secondary shockwave explosion that stuns bloons close to the epicenter and deals extra damage further from the main explosion. Bloons damaged by the inner shockwave get stunned for 0.5s, otherwise taking 1 damage. When given Burny Stuff, deals 2 damage per tick instead of 1 and burn twice as fast. Explosion radius of main explosion slightly increased from 28 to 38.

Path 1.name: The Big One
Path 1.description: Devastating explosions pop 7 layers of any Bloon type. Increases Burny Stuff damage further.
Path 1.effect: Explosion radius is even bigger (38 to 58), deals 10 damage per main explosion, stuns bloons for 0.75s instead of 0.5s, and increases pierce of main and secondary explosions from 45 to 85. When given Burny Stuff, deals 12 damage per tick instead of 2. Outer shockwave explosion now deals 2 damage and +2 damage to Ceramics, and can pop black bloons.

Path 1.name: The Biggest One
Path 1.description: Blasts deeply through Bloons and layers over a huge area, plus powerful Burny Stuff damage.
Path 1.effect: Creates gigantic explosions (58 to 74) that deal 25 damage per main explosion, plus +30 to Ceramics and MOAB-class, and pops 200 bloons instead of 85. Shockwave explosion deals +20 damage to Ceramics. When given Burny Stuff, deals 65 damage per tick instead of 7. In addition, Shockwave explosion now can stun MOAB-class bloons for short time.

Path 2.name: Faster Reload
Path 2.description: Increases the attack speed of the Mortar.
Path 2.effect: Gains +33% attack speed (an equivalent value from 0.75x attack cooldown).

Path 2.name: Rapid Reload
Path 2.description: Even faster reload.
Path 2.effect: Gains another +39% attack speed (an equivalent value from 0.72x attack cooldown), for a total of +85% attack speed (0.54x attack cooldown).

Path 2.name: Heavy Shells
Path 2.description: Heavy shells do extra damage to Ceramic, Lead, all Fortified, and all stunned Bloons. Attacks faster and can also pop Black Bloons.
Path 2.effect: Explosions pop Black Bloons and deal +3 damage to Ceramics, +1 damage to Leads, +1 damage to Fortified, +1 damage to MOAB-class, and +2 damage to stunned bloons. Gains +33% attack speed. When given Burny Stuff, deals 4 damage per tick instead of 1.

Path 2.name: Artillery Battery
Path 2.description: Bombardment Ability: Unleashes a rapid fire attack in a slightly wider area. Main attack does more damage to BADs and Boss Bloons and upgrades to 3 barrels for incredibly fast attacks.
Path 2.effect: 3x attack speed. Ability increases attack speed by another 4x and blast radius by +15%. Now deals +1 damage to BAD and Boss Bloons. When given Burny Stuff, deals 6 damage per tick instead of 4.

Path 2.name: Pop and Awe
Path 2.description: Pop and Awe has permanent rapid attack speed and enhances the BAD and Boss damage of all Artillery Batteries. Pop and Awe Ability: rains explosions over the whole screen, damaging Bloons and stunning them periodically.
Path 2.effect: Ability stuns all bloons on screen repetitively every 1 second for 8 seconds. Main attack gains its previous Bombardment ability permanently. Bonus damage to stunned bloons increased from +2 to +8 and bonus BAD and Boss damage from +1 to +2. Also now grants all Artillery Batteries extra +1 to BADs and Bosses damage on screen. When given Burny Stuff, deals 5 damage per tick instead of 3.

Path 3.name: Increased Accuracy
Path 3.description: Makes the shots more accurate.
Path 3.effect: Reduces deviation radius from 18 to 8.

Path 3.name: Burny Stuff
Path 3.description: Damaged Bloons are set ablaze momentarily with each hit.
Path 3.effect: Affected bloons slowly deal 1 damage every 1.25s for 3.75s after getting ignited with napalm. Napalm is amplified by Tier 3+ upgrades.

Path 3.name: Signal Flare
Path 3.description: Camo Bloons popped by flares lose their camouflage permanently.
Path 3.effect: Explosions produce wide non-damaging secondary flares that strip camo properties off any bloon hit, including Camo Blacks, Camo Zebras, and DDTs. Can detect Camo Bloons.

Path 3.name: Shattering Shells
Path 3.description: Shattering shells strip special Bloon properties off all but the biggest bloons. Burny stuff melts through 5 layers with each shot and burns MOAB-class Bloons for extra damage.
Path 3.effect: Strips all Camo and Regrow from all bloon types with each hit, and strips Fortified from all non-MOAB-class bloons, MOABs, and BFBs. Also deals 5 burn damage to bloons instead of 1, and 25 to MOAB-class Bloons. With Bloon Buster, burn damage deals +3 damage per tick and deals 33 damage to MOAB-class bloons.

Path 3.name: Blooncineration
Path 3.description: Superhot burny stuff that incinerates MOAB-Class Bloons with ease.
Path 3.effect: Burns twice as fast and deals 100 damage to blimps per damage tick. Blazes (resembling Walls of Fire) are also produced at the location where the explosions landed, dealing contact damage to passing bloons. Explosions now also strip fortified properties from DDTs. With Bloon Buster, deals 8 burn damage per tick instead of 5, 150 to blimps instead of 100, and also gives +2 damage to the Blazes.

Dartling Gunner.name: Dartling Gunner
Dartling Gunner.unlocked: Unlocked at 3,000,000 Pops, " Unlock By Pops " selection, Level 30
Dartling Gunner.cost: Cost Default : $720 ( Easy ) $850 ( Medium ) $920 ( Hard ) $1,020 ( Impoppable ) Advanced Logistics : $685 (Easy) $805 (Medium) $875 (Hard) $970 (Impoppable) Military Conscription : $480 (Easy) $570 (Medium) $615 (Hard) $685 (Impoppable) Both : $450 (Easy) $535 (Medium) $570 (Hard) $630 (Impoppable)
Dartling Gunner.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Rocket Storm M.A.D Emergency Unlock with M.K.
Dartling Gunner.targeting: Targeting Options Normal , Locked , Target Independent with B.A.D.S.
Dartling Gunner.related_towers: Dartling Gun (BTD4) , for the BTD4 counterpart Dartling Gun (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Dartling Gunner (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Focused Firing
Path 1.description: Increases accuracy of the Dartling Gun.
Path 1.effect: Decreases angular deviation from 23° to 9.6°, reducing projectile deviation by 60%. Also increases projectile lifespan for all Buckshot projectiles by +40%.

Path 1.name: Laser Shock
Path 1.description: Laser tipped shots shock bloons into popping again 1 second after being struck.
Path 1.effect: Every point of damage applies an extra electric shock damage-over-time onto affected Bloons. Dartling Gunners with this upgrade also deal bonus damage to shocked Bloons.

Path 1.name: Laser Cannon
Path 1.description: Rapidly fires much more powerful laser blasts that can pop Frozen Bloons, and deal increased MOAB damage.
Path 1.effect: Converts into a laser attack that deals increased damage and pierce, plus even more to MOAB-class. Damage improves from 1 to 2, pierce from 1 to 6, and additionally improves duration of Laser Shock effect. No longer pops purple Bloons.

Path 1.name: Plasma Accelerator
Path 1.description: Concentrates a powerful beam of energy to a single point.
Path 1.effect: Generates a powerful beam of energy towards a single point instead of shooting fast lasers, popping bloons that make regular contact with them. Any remaining pierce from the beam itself is used to inflict greater damage at the endpoint. Affected bloons additionally will be affected by an even longer-lasting Laser Shock effect.Now pops leads

Path 1.name: Ray of Doom
Path 1.description: Creates a solid line of annihilation. You can erase most Bloons at your leisure.
Path 1.effect: Produces an endless death ray that rapidly destroys bloons, inflicts huge damage, and pierces up to 1000 bloons instead of 50. Deals an additional +55 against the first bloon damage. Laser Shock deals much more damage. Can pop purple Bloons.

Path 2.name: Advanced Targeting
Path 2.description: Allows Dartling Gunner to hit Camo Bloons.
Path 2.effect: Self-explanatory

Path 2.name: Faster Barrel Spin
Path 2.description: Makes gun fire much faster.
Path 2.effect: Attacks +50% faster (0.66x attack cooldown).

Path 2.name: Hydra Rocket Pods
Path 2.description: Shoots depleted bloontonium missiles that can damage all Bloon types and trigger multiple explosions.
Path 2.effect: Hydra Rocket Pod missiles damage any bloon type, does 2 damage per explosion, and produce up to 3 low-pierce explosions by default. Gains even more explosions with pierce buffs.

Path 2.name: Rocket Storm
Path 2.description: Rocket Storm ability: Launches a powerful storm of rockets in a wide cone.
Path 2.effect: Ability generates waves of erratically moving rockets that deal 5 damage per shot onto up to 8 bloons per explosion. Main attack gains more pierce, increasing pierce of explosions by +2 and increasing number of explosions by +1.

Path 2.name: M.A.D
Path 2.description: Moab Assured Destroyer. Slower firing mega missiles do extreme damage to MOAB-class Bloons.
Path 2.effect: Main attack deals 3 damage each plus an extra +550 to MOAB-class and increases pierce to 12, but attacks three times as slow, and alternates attacks between two arms. Ability gains extra pierce and deals more damage to Ceramics and MOAB-class.

Path 3.name: Faster Swivel
Path 3.description: Gun can swivel much faster.
Path 3.effect: Dartling Gunner rotates towards the pointer over twice as fast.

Path 3.name: Powerful Darts
Path 3.description: Darts move faster and can pop 3 bloons each.
Path 3.effect: Darts gain +2 pierce per shot, pop Frozen, and increases projectile speed and projectile size by 50%. For Hydra Rocket Pods, gains +2 pierce and one more explosion plus extra blast radius, most other Tier 3 crosspaths and above receive +50% pierce overall.

Path 3.name: Buckshot
Path 3.description: Shoots blasts of deadly buckshot instead of darts.
Path 3.effect: Blasts out slow bursts of deadly buckshot instead of spinning rapid-fire darts. Buckshot balls deal 4 damage, pierces through 4 bloons per buckshot, and can knock back bloons. Accuracy decreases and projectiles have much shorter lifespan. With Laser Shock, improves Laser Shock to deal 2 damage per tic instead of 1, and take +2 extra damage from Dartling Gunners with Laser Shock.

Path 3.name: Bloon Area Denial System
Path 3.description: 4-barreled auto-cannon that can be set to attack automatically.
Path 3.effect: Upgrades into a tall 4-barreled auto-cannon that alternates attacks per cannon, allowing it to attack 4x faster than normal. Can be set to attack automatically. With Laser Shock, improves Laser Shock to deal 3 damage per tic instead of 2, and take +3 extra damage from Dartling Gunners with Laser Shock.

Path 3.name: Bloon Exclusion Zone
Path 3.description: Upgraded to 6 barrels and massively increased damage. Bloons are excluded from existence.
Path 3.effect: Further upgrades into 6 barrels for even faster attack speed and gains even more buckshots per cannon. Buckshots deal 8 damage instead of 4, and pierce 6 bloons instead of 4. With Laser Shock, improves Laser Shock to deal 6 damage per tic instead of 3, and take +6 extra damage from Dartling Gunners with Laser Shock.

Wizard Monkey.name: Wizard Monkey
Wizard Monkey.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Summon Phoenix Wizard Lord Phoenix
Wizard Monkey.targeting: Targeting Options First , Last , Close , Strong , Camo Priority with Monkey Sense If purchased, Wall of Fire will default to Close . With Guided Magic , Wall of Fire obeys set Target Priority .
Wizard Monkey.related_towers: Monkey Apprentice (BTD4) , for the BTD4 counterpart Monkey Apprentice (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Wizard Monkey (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Guided Magic
Path 1.description: Magic shots seek out the Bloons, even behind cover.
Path 1.effect: All magical bolts can ignore Line of Sight and can seek at bloons. Most other attacks also ignore Line of Sight and gain further projectile lifespan. Phoenixes with Guided Magic can lightly home.

Path 1.name: Arcane Blast
Path 1.description: Bigger more powerful magic blasts pop through 2 layers of Bloon.
Path 1.effect: Main bolt's projectile size increased and now deals 2 damage. Fireballs with this crosspath deal +1 damage.

Path 1.name: Arcane Mastery
Path 1.description: Faster attacks with increased range, damage, and popping power.
Path 1.effect: Gains +20 range, 2x attack speed, deals 3 damage per bolt instead of 2, and pops +4 bloons.

Path 1.name: Arcane Spike
Path 1.description: Faster firing magic does huge damage to most Bloon types.
Path 1.effect: Deals 6 damage per shot and 16 versus MOAB-class. Attacks 4x faster than an unupgraded Wizard and can pop Lead Bloons.

Path 1.name: Archmage
Path 1.description: A true master of magical wizardry. Attack faster and does more damage to MOAB-Class Bloons.
Path 1.effect: Even higher damage bolts deal 8 damage and 27 MOAB-class damage and attack twice as fast as Arcane Spike. Additionally gains Dragon's Breath and Shimmer attacks, and all additional attacks gain twice as fast speed and deal four times damage to MOAB-Class Bloons (including crosspathing path 2 Fireball and Wall of Fire).

Path 2.name: Fireball
Path 2.description: Every few seconds casts an explosive fireball spell.
Path 2.effect: Every 2.2s, produces a fireball that explodes on impact. Fireballs cannot explode if collided onto Purple Bloons, and fireball explosions cannot damage Black properties.

Path 2.name: Wall of Fire
Path 2.description: Creates a super hot wall of fire across the track to roast the Bloons as they pass.
Path 2.effect: Creates a blaze of fire onto the closest region of bloon track. The blaze will regularly damage bloons as they pass through. Crosspathing with Guided Magic allows Wall of Fire placement to be manually adjusted, and also lasting 6.5s instead of 4.5s.

Path 2.name: Dragon's Breath
Path 2.description: Spews endless flames at nearby Bloons and enhances Fireball and Wall of Fire.
Path 2.effect: Rapidly spews flames at bloons. Flames deal 2 damage and sets affected bloons on fire for more damage. Hurls a triple fireball spell, each fireball dealing 3 damage and 14 blast radius. Wall of Fire spawns every 4.5s and gains +10 pierce, and increases tick rate of Wall of Fire.

Path 2.name: Summon Phoenix
Path 2.description: Summon Phoenix ability: Powerful phoenix wreaks Bloon havoc for 20 seconds.
Path 2.effect: Ability generates a phoenix that rapidly spews flames which deal 5 damage each. Phoenix has infinite range, ignores line of sight, last up to 20 seconds, and has a 45 second cooldown. Phoenix flames lightly home with 1-4-0 crosspath. Main wizard gains a double flame attack that burns more damage.

Path 2.name: Wizard Lord Phoenix
Path 2.description: Wizard Lord becomes a master of the flame, turning into a super powerful Lava Phoenix for a short time.
Path 2.effect: Enhances damage of all fire-related attacks, Dragon's Breath attack gains 46 pierce and damage increased from 2 to 6. Wall of Fire damage increased from 1 to 5 and fireball damage is tripled. Phoenix is now permanent. Ability now transforms the monkey into a super-phoenix that spews even stronger flames and regular volleys of powerful meteors.

Path 3.name: Intense Magic
Path 3.description: More powerful magic shots move faster and can pop more Bloons.
Path 3.effect: Bolt gains +5 pierce and moves faster. Most fire-based attacks gain a certain amount of bonus pierce.

Path 3.name: Monkey Sense
Path 3.description: Increase range slightly and allows the Wizard to hit Camo Bloons.
Path 3.effect:
Wizard gains +10 range, camo detection and can access
Camo Prioritization
.

Path 3.name: Shimmer
Path 3.description: Gains a dark magic attack that periodically reveals location of all nearby Camo bloons permanently.
Path 3.effect: Gains a shimmer attack. If bloons get within range, the Wizard periodically produces dark waves of magic that permanently remove camo properties off bloons. Also gains +10 range.

Path 3.name: Necromancer: Unpopped Army
Path 3.description: Reanimate recently popped enemies as servants to destroy the Bloons.
Path 3.effect:
Stores
Undead Bloons
into its personal graveyard every time any tower pops bloons within its range, and spawns them out to attack bloons. Undead Bloons pop any bloon type. Undead Bloons gain further pierce, damage, and attack speed as the graveyard count grows. All the Wizard's other attacks also gain up to +2 damage as the graveyard grows.

Path 3.name: Prince of Darkness
Path 3.description: Reanimate even more powerful Bloon servants to obliterate the enemy and enhances all other Necromancers.
Path 3.effect: Expands its personal graveyard greatly, Undead Bloons last longer, and can now also summon Undead MOABs and Undead BFBs that deal even more damage and pop more bloons. Improves damage and lifespan of all Undead Bloons on screen including its own. The Wizard's other attacks can now gain up to +10 damage with a full graveyard. Also gains a massive range of 80.

Super Monkey.name: Super Monkey
Super Monkey.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Tech Terror The Anti-Bloon Darkshift ( Dark Knight )
Super Monkey.targeting: Targeting Options First , Last , Close , Strong , Camo Priority with Ultravision
Super Monkey.related_towers: Super Monkey (pre-BTD4) , for the pre-BTD4 counterpart Super Monkey (BTD4) , for the BTD4 counterpart Super Monkey (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Super Monkey (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Laser Blasts
Path 1.description: Shoots powerful blasts of laser instead of darts.
Path 1.effect: Gains +1 pierce and pops Frozen Bloons. Can no longer pop Purples, and cannot pop Leads.

Path 1.name: Plasma Blasts
Path 1.description: Plasma vaporizes almost everything it touches.
Path 1.effect: Attacks 1.5x faster (0.03 second attack cooldown) and pops Lead Bloons. Cannot pop Purples.

Path 1.name: Sun Avatar
Path 1.description: Channels power from the core of the Sun.
Path 1.effect:
Shoots three waves of sunbeams per shot. Each sunbeam pops up to 6 bloons. Can't pop Purple Bloons, unless the player has the
Strike Down The False
Knowledge path enabled.

Path 1.name: Sun Temple
Path 1.description: Tower sacrifices enhance and modify the Temple's attacks.
Path 1.effect: Sacrifices all towers within range and absorbs their power into its own special attacks based on both tower categorization and sacrifice values.

Path 1.name: True Sun God
Path 1.description: Tremble before the AWESOME power of the TRUE Sun God!!
Path 1.effect:
Sacrifices all towers within range once again, again absorbing their power into its own special attacks based on both tower categorization and sacrifice values.
Keep in mind that the
True Sun God
also has a secret variety; The
Vengeful True Sun God
- a much more powerful variant. Visit its page for more information, but beware of spoilers.

Path 2.name: Super Range
Path 2.description: Super Monkeys need Super Range.
Path 2.effect: Gains +10 range and +1 pierce.

Path 2.name: Epic Range
Path 2.description: Why settle for super when you can have EPIC?
Path 2.effect: Gains a further +12 range, extra +2 pierce and +75% projectile speed.

Path 2.name: Robo Monkey
Path 2.description: Half Super Monkey, half killer robot of death. Shoots from 2 guns at once and can crit!
Path 2.effect: Gains +2 pierce and shoots from both arms at once. Arms have independent targeting and cannot both have the same target priorities. Does Crits every 15-20th shot that deals 10 damage.

Path 2.name: Tech Terror
Path 2.description: Annihilation ability: Destroys most Bloons completely and utterly within blast radius.
Path 2.effect: Base attack becomes dual plasma cannons that each shoot green plasma, for +3 pierce per plasma ball. Ability instantly deals 2600 damage to up to 2000 bloons within the blast range, and every third use inflicts crits for 3900 damage.

Path 2.name: The Anti-Bloon
Path 2.description: <Program Directive> <Eradicate Bloons> <INITIATE>
Path 2.effect: Ability instantly deals 10,400 damage (15,600 with critical ability) to up to 2,000 bloons within a bigger blast range. Main attack becomes much stronger, gaining +4 damage, +5 pierce, pops any bloon type, and the Super Monkey gains +10 range. Does Crits every 13-17th shot that deals 50 damage.

Path 3.name: Knockback
Path 3.description: Bloons get pushed backwards or slowed after each hit.
Path 3.effect: Push back non-Lead and non-Ceramic bloons by 25%, and slow down Leads and Ceramics (including their fortified variants) by 60%. MOABs are slowed by 30% (except BADs and Bosses, which cannot be slowed at all).

Path 3.name: Ultravision
Path 3.description: Enables Super Monkey to shoot slightly further, see and do more damage to Camo Bloons.
Path 3.effect:
+3 range, gains camo detection and deal +1 damage to Camo Bloons. With the
X-Ray Ultra
MK, allows the Super Monkey to see and shoot through any blocking objects.

Path 3.name: Dark Knight
Path 3.description: Dark blades increase knockback and pierce and deal extra damage to MOAB-class Bloons. Gains Darkshift ability to shift to a nearby location.
Path 3.effect: Gains +2 MOAB-class damage, Leads and Ceramics slowed by 90%, and gains +3 pierce. Can teleport onto any valid land location within range with a new ability.

Path 3.name: Dark Champion
Path 3.description: Champion dark blades excel at puncturing and ruining all Bloon types. Darkshift ability extends mapwide.
Path 3.effect: Gains +1 damage to all bloons, another +1 damage to Camos, another +1 damage to MOAB-class, +2 damage to ceramics, can completely lock Leads and Ceramics, doubles attack speed, gains another +4 pierce, and pops any bloon type. Projectiles now ricochet from Bloon to Bloon with a 0.1s delay. Ability now allows it to teleport to any valid land location on screen.

Path 3.name: Legend of the Night
Path 3.description: We turn to him, when all hope is lost...
Path 3.effect: If bloons reach the exit, a black hole is summoned on all exits, deleting any bloons passing through them. Black holes last for up to 7.5s with a 3 minute cooldown, and a max of 2 times per round per tower. Main attack gains +8 damage and +15 pierce, and additional +16 damage against MOAB-class, extra +2 versus Ceramics, and another +2 versus Camo.

Ninja Monkey.name: Ninja Monkey
Ninja Monkey.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Bloon Sabotage Grand Saboteur
Ninja Monkey.targeting: Targeting Options First , Last , Close , Strong , Camo Priority ( Caltrops locked to Normal if purchased)
Ninja Monkey.camo: Camo Detection Yes (can decamo with x-2-x)
Ninja Monkey.related_towers: Ninja Monkey (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Ninja Monkey (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Ninja Discipline
Path 1.description: Increases attack speed.
Path 1.effect: All attacks gain +42.8% attack speed (0.7x attack cooldown).

Path 1.name: Sharp Shurikens
Path 1.description: Shurikens can pop 4 Bloons each.
Path 1.effect: +2 pierce for each shuriken, from 2 to 4, effectively doubling pierce of each shuriken.

Path 1.name: Double Shot
Path 1.description: Throws 2 shurikens at once.
Path 1.effect: Throws 2 shurikens per shot in a narrow spread.

Path 1.name: Bloonjitsu
Path 1.description: Throws 5 shurikens at once!
Path 1.effect: Now throws 5 shurikens per shot instead of 2.

Path 1.name: Grandmaster Ninja
Path 1.description: Throws incredibly fast, 8 shurikens per shot!
Path 1.effect: Throws 8 shurikens at once, with 2 damage and +222% faster (0.31x attack cooldown). Also gains +10 range.

Path 2.name: Distraction
Path 2.description: Some Bloons will become distracted and move backwards.
Path 2.effect: Shurikens gain a 15% chance to blow back bloons.

Path 2.name: Counter-Espionage
Path 2.description: Ninja attacks can strip camo from Bloons they damage.
Path 2.effect: Self-explanatory

Path 2.name: Shinobi Tactics
Path 2.description: Increases attack speed and pierce of nearby Ninjas. Stacks 20 times.
Path 2.effect: Increases attack speed of itself and other Ninjas in range by +8% multiplicatively and pierce by +8% additively. Stacks up to 20 times.

Path 2.name: Bloon Sabotage
Path 2.description: Sabotage ability: Lasts 15 seconds. During the sabotage, all Bloons move at half speed.
Path 2.effect: Ability slows down all bloons on screen and any incoming bloons by 50% for 15 seconds. Cannot soak through MOAB-class layers nor affect BADs and Bosses.

Path 2.name: Grand Saboteur
Path 2.description: Ability duration is longer, and MOAB-Class Bloons spawn with less health during the sabotage. Buffs all Shinobi.
Path 2.effect: Ability lasts twice as long and MOAB-class bloons spawning from the entrance, BADs included but not Bosses, start with 25% less health. Ability also grants all Shinobis or above on screen +10 range and +2 damage to MOAB-class bloons.

Path 3.name: Seeking Shuriken
Path 3.description: Increased attack range and shurikens will seek out and pop Bloons automatically.
Path 3.effect: Shurikens will aggressively seek out bloons, regardless of where they are. Range increases by +7.

Path 3.name: Caltrops
Path 3.description: Throws out spiked caltrops onto the track nearby.
Path 3.effect: Regularly throws out caltrops onto nearby track. Pops up to 6 bloons per caltrop. Lasts for 1 round or 35 seconds, whichever comes first.

Path 3.name: Flash Bomb
Path 3.description: Combination attack! Alternates flash bombs that stun many Bloons and shuriken deal increased damage to stunned targets.
Path 3.effect: Every 4th shuriken, the Ninja instead throws a Flash Bomb that stuns bloons for 1.3 seconds and pops any bloon type including Leads and Blacks, dealing 3 damage onto up to 30 bloons at once. Shurikens deal +3 damage to stunned bloons.

Path 3.name: Sticky Bomb
Path 3.description: Throws powerful timed charges at MOAB-Class Bloons.
Path 3.effect: Throws sticky bombs onto nearby MOAB-class bloons every few seconds. Sticky bombs detonate after 3.0s, dealing 450 damage to that blimp and 100 damage, 10 pierce, and 40 blast radius to bloons around it upon detonation. Range increases from 47 to 55. Shuriken deals +3 damage to stickied targets.

Path 3.name: Master Bomber
Path 3.description: One Monkey MOAB demolition machine.
Path 3.effect: Throws stronger sticky bombs over any distance that stun affected blimps and deal 3000 damage upon detonation instead of 450, damage of area explosion increases from 100 to 600. Flash bomb attack deals more damage and briefly stuns blimps too, while caltrops deal 5 damage instead of one and +5 more to ceramics. Shuriken deals more damage to stunned and stickied targets.

Alchemist.name: Alchemist
Alchemist.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Transforming Tonic Total Transformation
Alchemist.targeting: Targeting Options First , Last , Close , Strong
Alchemist.damage: Damage 1 (attack potion and acid pools) 1 / 2.0s for 4.0s (corrosion DoT )

Path 1.name: Larger Potions
Path 1.description: Potions splash over more Bloons in a larger area.
Path 1.effect: Acid potion attack deals a larger splash radius and can hit up to 20 bloons per shot instead of 15. Also increases pierce and splash radius of additional potions and monster lasers.

Path 1.name: Acidic Mixture Dip
Path 1.description: Throws a helpful potion at nearby Monkeys that allows them to pop Lead Bloons and do extra damage to Ceramic and MOAB-Class Bloons. Wears off after several attacks.
Path 1.effect: Regularly throws acidic mixture dip potions at monkeys, boosting their damage to Ceramics and MOAB-class by +1 and allows them to pop Leads, with extra damage to fortified Leads but not fortified DDTs. Lasts for 10 shots, 12 with 2-2-0. Stacks up to 30 shots.

Path 1.name: Berserker Brew
Path 1.description: Special brew gives Monkeys extra damage, range, and attack speed. Lasts longer.
Path 1.effect:
Gives special brew to nearby Monkeys every 8 seconds (6.4s with
Faster Throwing) that temporarily provide +1 damage, +10% range, +10% attack speed, and +2 pierce. Wears off after 25 attacks or for 5 seconds (after 40 attacks or for 6 seconds with Perishing Potions), whichever comes first. Always targets closest buffable tower. There is a cooldown of 5.0s (4.0s with Perishing Potions) before a new brew can be reapplied to the same tower.

Path 1.name: Stronger Stimulant
Path 1.description: Extra strong berserker brew has even more powerful
Path 1.effect:
on the target. Lasts even longer.
Effect:
Improves brew to provide further attack speed, pierce, and range. For the duration of the improved brew, gives +15% range, +17.6% attack speed, +3 pierce, and +1 damage. Lasts for 40 shots and lasts up to 12 seconds(for 55 shots and lasts up to 13 seconds with Perishing Potions). There is a cooldown of 5.0s (4.0s with Perishing Potions) before a new brew can be reapplied to the same tower.

Path 1.name: Permanent Brew
Path 1.description: Berserker brew becomes PERMANENT on Monkeys who drink it.
Path 1.effect: Brew and acidic mixture dips now last indefinitely, provided that the Permanent Brew is still on screen. Effects immediately disappear if this Alchemist is sold or sacrificed.

Path 2.name: Stronger Acid
Path 2.description: Acid potions dissolve Bloons faster.
Path 2.effect: Improves red acid into a stronger purple acid. Acid damage-over-time tick rate now increases from every 2.0s to every 1.5s, and increases lifespan of the acid from 4.0s to 4.5s.

Path 2.name: Perishing Potions
Path 2.description: Attack potions deal more damage to MOAB-class Bloons and strip Fortified off smaller Bloons. Buff potions last longer.
Path 2.effect: Acid now can strip Fortified off non-blimp bloons, and attacks deal 5 damage to MOAB-class, 20 damage to Fortified MOAB-class. Also increases duration of Berserker Brew and Stronger Stimulant, decreases downtime of expired brews, and improves shot counts of all Alchemist buffs except Permanent Brew.

Path 2.name: Unstable Concoction
Path 2.description: Coats MOAB-Class Bloons in an explosive substance that causes a large explosion when they are popped.
Path 2.effect: Coats MOAB-class bloons with an explosive substance. MOAB-class bloons affected by them will produce explosions with damage equivalent to 10% of its base health (i.e. no health ramping), including Fortified.

Path 2.name: Transforming Tonic
Path 2.description: Transformation ability: Turns Alchemist into powerful attack Monster for 20 seconds.
Path 2.effect: Ability stops the Alchemist's main attacks and transforms it into a monster with +27 range that fires a 3 damage and 6 pierce laser beam every 0.03s (0.024s with Faster Throwing crosspath) that can pop any bloon type except Purple.

Path 2.name: Total Transformation
Path 2.description: Transforms five Monkeys nearby into crazy attack monsters for 20 seconds.
Path 2.effect: Ability now affects up to 5 nearby monkeys up to Tier 3 into laser-shooting monsters. Ability cooldown is decreased. Most transformed monkeys can inherit tower-exclusive buffs on top.

Path 3.name: Faster Throwing
Path 3.description: Throws potions and attacks faster.
Path 3.effect: Attacks and throws potions +25% faster (0.80x attack cooldown).

Path 3.name: Acid Pool
Path 3.description: Every few attacks spills an acid pool on the track, and if no Bloons are nearby Alchemist can drench nearby track with acid.
Path 3.effect: Every 5th attack spills an acid pool where the potion had hit. Produces pools of acid on nearby bloon track if there are no bloons within range. Can also produce acid pools if its main potion misses bloons.

Path 3.name: Lead To Gold
Path 3.description: Converts Lead Bloons to GOLD! Special solvents do extra damage to Lead Bloons, destroying them in one shot and generating cash.
Path 3.effect: Deals +9 damage to lead properties and rewards $50 every time it pops a Lead Bloon.

Path 3.name: Rubber to Gold
Path 3.description: Converts all Bloons partially into gold, getting more cash per pop from affected Bloons.
Path 3.effect: Regularly produces a goldify potion that partially converts bloons into gold. The effect lasts for 14 seconds and disables Bloon properties. Affected bloons give +100% more income.

Path 3.name: Bloon Master Alchemist
Path 3.description: Secret shrink potion converts all affected Bloons to Red Bloons.
Path 3.effect: Throws a shrink potion that converts up to 200 bloons into Red Bloons, including MOAB-class (up to a ZOMG and visible DDT), although MOAB-class bloons consume more pierce. Shrink potions have unlimited range and always target the strongest transformable bloon types on screen. Does not reward extra money for converted bloons.

Druid.name: Druid
Druid.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Jungle's Bounty Spirit of the Forest
Druid.targeting: Targeting Options First , Last , Close , Strong
Druid.camo: Camo Detection Yes (5-x-x and x-5-x brambles only)

Path 1.name: Hard Thorns
Path 1.description: Hard thorns can pop 2 bloons each and can pop all bloon types.
Path 1.effect: Druid thorns gain +1 pierce, and all thorns pop Frozen and Lead. For Druids of the Jungle and Spirit of the Forest, on-track vines now pop all bloon types.

Path 1.name: Heart of Thunder
Path 1.description: Unleashes regular blasts of forked lightning that arc from bloon to bloon.
Path 1.effect: Creates regular blasts of forked lightning onto bloons as it attacks, splitting repetitively and affecting up to 31 bloons per lightning bolt, inflicting 2 damage to each bloon damaged.

Path 1.name: Druid of the Storm
Path 1.description: Gusts of wind blow Bloons off the track away from the exit.
Path 1.effect: Creates small tornadoes that home towards Bloons, blowing away up to 24 Bloons backwards. Tornadoes consume extra pierce versus Ceramics.

Path 1.name: Ball Lightning
Path 1.description: Creates powerful balls of lightning that can freeze Bloons. Additional lightning bolts arc off main attack to nearby Bloons.
Path 1.effect: Creates moving balls of lightning that shoot high-damage lightning bolts. The ball freezes bloons on contact including white and zebra bloons. Also can create stronger tornadoes that consume no extra pierce against Ceramics, and improves basic lightning damage.

Path 1.name: Monarch of Storms
Path 1.description: Superstorm blasts all Bloon types for massive damage and blows them away from the exit.
Path 1.effect: Creates supertornadoes that blow away up to 200 bloons including MOAB-class, although MOAB-class consume more pierce. Additional Ball Lightnings are produced the longer the supertornadoes last. Most attacks gain even more damage. Also gains camo detection.

Path 2.name: Thorn Swarm
Path 2.description: Shoots 8 thorns per shot instead of 5.
Path 2.effect: Shoots 8 thorn projectiles instead of 5 thorn projectiles.

Path 2.name: Heart of Oak
Path 2.description: Attacks convert Regrow Bloons into normal Bloons. Gains 1% pierce for every life gained from the starting value after the upgrade. Maxes at 100% and diminishes if lives are lost.
Path 2.effect: Regrow Bloons damaged from the Druid's attacks lose Regrow properties permanently. Gains the oak buff, increasing pierce of all attacks for net gained lives, with +0% starting amount. All pierce-buffable attacks (i.e. other than lightning) gain +1% pierce per life gained after this upgrade, up to +100%, and loses that bonus pierce for every life lost.

Path 2.name: Druid of the Jungle
Path 2.description: Calls a vine from the ground to entangle and crush Bloons one at a time, leaving behind a deadly thorn pile.
Path 2.effect: The Druid now summons a vine with infinite range, which will kill the strongest non-MOAB bloon on screen, strangling onto that bloon until it withers into nothing, taking longer the more powerful the bloon is. This vine grab has a minimum 2.6 second cooldown, and the vine must fully digest the bloon before grabbing a new bloon. It also leaves behind a bramble ("after-vine") that constantly damages passing bloons. The vine deals extremely high damage per second, and ignores line of sight.

Path 2.name: Jungle's Bounty
Path 2.description: Vines create stronger thorn piles. Jungle's Bounty Ability: Generates cash and 1 life each use, plus extra cash per Banana Farm near the Druid.
Path 2.effect: Gains +10 range, and grants an ability which generates 1 life and $320, plus $130 more per Banana Farm within range. Vine grabs have lower minimum cooldown, and after-vines have much more pierce and damage.

Path 2.name: Spirit of the Forest
Path 2.description: Grows thorned vines along the path that deal constant damage plus bonus damage to ceramics. Vines nearest the Spirit of the Forest do more damage. Activated ability generates lives and more cash.
Path 2.effect: Continually grows thorned vines starting from its direct location and grows more vines outwards every 0.5s. Thorned vines deal constant damage to bloons passing through, and deal more damage if closer to the Druid. Also greatly strengthens most attacks. Ability also provides 25 lives per use. Gives 1000 cash every round. Also with the monkey knowledge "Vine Rupture" the Druid gains an ability to explode all the vines in the screen, after about 5 seconds the vines will regrow.

Path 3.name: Druidic Reach
Path 3.description: Increases range by a large amount.
Path 3.effect: Gains +10 range (28% more than base), from 35 to 45.

Path 3.name: Heart of Vengeance
Path 3.description: Gains 10% attack speed and 1% for every life lost from the starting value after the upgrade. Maxes at 50% and diminishes if lives are restored.
Path 3.effect: Gains the vengeance buff, increasing attack speed of all attacks for net lost lives, with a starting amount of +10%. All attacks gain +1% attack speed per life lost after this upgrade, up to +50%, and loses that bonus attack speed for every life gained.

Path 3.name: Druid of Wrath
Path 3.description: Gains attack speed during the round as long as the Druid is attacking Bloons.
Path 3.effect: Gains +0.5% attack speed every time it does 1 point of damage to bloons, up to +100%. Wrath attack speed bonus resets if not attacking within 2 seconds.

Path 3.name: Poplust
Path 3.description: Boosts attack speed and pierce for all Druids in the radius. Can stack up to 5 times on a single Druid.
Path 3.effect: Nearby Druids gain increased pierce and attack speed by +15%, stackable additively up to 5 times for +75% pierce and attack speed.

Path 3.name: Avatar of Wrath
Path 3.description: The more bloons there are, the more damage it does!
Path 3.effect: Double attack speed for all attacks, +5 range, and deals 4 damage per thorn by default, plus another +1 damage every 3000 RBE on screen, capped at +30. Also gives equal damage-ramping for lightning if given the Heart of Thunder upgrade.

Banana Farm.name: Banana Farm
Banana Farm.cost: Cost Default: $1,060 ( Easy ) $1,250 ( Medium ) $1,350 ( Hard ) $1,500 ( Impoppable ) Flat Pack Buildings : $1,040 (Easy) $1,225 (Medium) $1,325 (Hard) $1,470 (Impoppable)
Banana Farm.targeting: Targeting Options None, erratic distribution of bananas, or spawn with x-x-3+
Banana Farm.incomeboosts: Income/Life Boosts $20 (per set of bananas, 4 sets per round)
Banana Farm.related_towers: Banana Farm (BTD4) , for the BTD4 counterpart Banana Farm (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Banana Farm (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Increased Production
Path 1.description: Grows 2 extra Banana bunches per round.
Path 1.effect: Produces 2 extra bananas per round. By default, it increases from 4 to 6.

Path 1.name: Greater Production
Path 1.description: Grows 2 MORE extra Banana bunches per round.
Path 1.effect: Produces 2 extra bananas per round. By default, it increases from 6 to 8.

Path 1.name: Banana Plantation
Path 1.description: Grows 16 Banana bunches per round.
Path 1.effect: Produces 16 bananas per round instead of 8.

Path 1.name: Banana Research Facility
Path 1.description: Produces 5 large Banana crates every round worth $300 each.
Path 1.effect: Instead of bananas, produces 5 crates per round, each crate worth $300.

Path 1.name: Banana Central
Path 1.description: You want Banana? We have Banana!
Path 1.effect: Crates are worth 4x more, for $1200 per crate. All Banana Research Facility crates are worth +25% more, rounded down.

Path 2.name: Long Life Bananas
Path 2.description: Bananas last 30 seconds before rotting instead of 15.
Path 2.effect: Self-explanatory

Path 2.name: Valuable Bananas
Path 2.description: Bananas are worth 25% more cash per bunch.
Path 2.effect:
Self-explanatory
, the final value is rounded down.

Path 2.name: Monkey Bank
Path 2.description: All money generated by this farm is now stored in the bank and earns 15% interest each round.
Path 2.effect: Changes banana generation to automatically generate money and store in a bank, $56.25, 4 times, for a total of $225 per round excluding end-of-round interest. Increases stored cash by 15% at the end of a round, limited to $7000 stored cash. Stored cash can be collected at any time.

Path 2.name: IMF Loan
Path 2.description: IMF Loan ability: Gives you $9,000 but you have to pay it back over time.
Path 2.effect: Increases bank storage limit from $7,000 to $10,000. Gains the IMF Loan ability, which generates $9,000 instantly, but automatically depletes 50% of all subsequent income until the debt is consumed in total.

Path 2.name: Monkey-Nomics
Path 2.description: For when you're too big to fail...
Path 2.effect: Ability generates $9,000 with no debt. Ability cooldown is reduced to 60s, and can be used 2 times per round, per Monkey-Nomics.

Path 3.name: EZ Collect
Path 3.description: The collect radius of Bananas is larger and uncollected bananas auto-collect for half value. Monkey Banks will glow when full and ready to collect.
Path 3.effect: Increases area where bananas and crates can be collected by double, and all expired bananas and crates autocollect for 50% of their original value. Also makes banks signs glow when they are full.

Path 3.name: Banana Salvage
Path 3.description: Uncollected Bananas auto-collect for almost their full amount, and Banks auto-collect when full. Farm sellback rate increased by 10%
Path 3.effect: Expired bananas and crates are auto-collected for 85% of their value, and Farms with this upgrade sell for +10% more. Banks autocollects as soon as they become full on the next round.

Path 3.name: Marketplace
Path 3.description: Generates money each round and adds it to your total. No fuss.
Path 3.effect: Instead of collectable bananas, automatically generates money. Generates $20 automatically 16 times, for a total of $320 per round.

Path 3.name: Central Market
Path 3.description: Earns heaps of money each round and gives Merchantmen +10% income.
Path 3.effect:
Increases generated money from $20 to $70, for a total of $1120 per round. Gives
Merchantman
+10% income per Central Market, stacks up to 10x, for +100% income.

Path 3.name: Monkey Wall Street
Path 3.description: Hub of Monkey trades earns colossal income, generates lives each round and, collects income in radius.
Path 3.effect:
Generates the same amount of money as a Central Market, but adds $4000 and 15 lives at the end of each round. Also automatically gathers nearby collectibles within a default range of 75, like a
Banana Farmer
.

Spike Factory.name: Spike Factory
Spike Factory.cost: Cost Default: $850 ( Easy ) $1,000 ( Medium ) $1,080 ( Hard ) $1,200 ( Impoppable ) First Last Line of Defense : $700 (Easy) $850 (Medium) $930 (Hard) $1,050 (Impoppable)
Spike Factory.targeting: Targeting Options Normal . If Smart Spikes purchased, then Close , Far , and Smart are available.
Spike Factory.related_towers: Spike Factory (BTD4) , for the BTD4 counterpart Spike Factory (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Spike Factory (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Bigger Stacks
Path 1.description: Creates larger piles of spikes per shot.
Path 1.effect: Spike piles gain +5 pierce. For Perma-Spike, gains +35 pierce.

Path 1.name: White Hot Spikes
Path 1.description: Cuts through Lead Bloons and Frozen Bloons.
Path 1.effect: Can pop Frozen and Lead Bloons.

Path 1.name: Spiked Balls
Path 1.description: Produces spiked balls that do extra damage to Ceramic and Fortified bloons.
Path 1.effect: Pierce of each spike pile increases from 10 to 11, and increases damage from 1 to 2, plus even more to Ceramic and Fortified (+1 to Fortified, +3 to Ceramic).

Path 1.name: Spiked Mines
Path 1.description: Spiked mines explode violently when they lose all their spikes.
Path 1.effect: Increases Ceramic damage bonus from +3 to +6, and Fortified damage from +1 to +3. Pierce of each spike pile increases from 11 to 18. Mines produce explosions that deal 10 damage (+2 to Ceramics, +3 to Fortified) with 30 pierce upon depletion of its spikes or by expiration, plus a burning effect that deals 10 damage per 2 seconds for up to 6 seconds. If expired by time, explosions deal double damage (20 damage).

Path 1.name: Super Mines
Path 1.description: Creates gigantic exploding spiked mines that can wipe out almost anything.
Path 1.effect: Reduces production speed to every 3.5s, and increases spike damage from 2 to 50. Creates mini explosions every time a spike wears out (20 damage, 30 pierce), and causes 1000 (2000 if the mine expires over time) damage, 60 pierce explosions once the super mine fully depletes its spikes or expires. Increases damage to Ceramics and Fortified massively (+30 to Ceramics and +15 to Fortified per spike, +15 and +5 per mini explosion, +500 and +250 per main explosion). Napalm DoT increases from 10 to 2500.

Path 2.name: Faster Production
Path 2.description: Rapidly increases production rate.
Path 2.effect: Produces spikes +25% faster (0.80x attack cooldown).

Path 2.name: Even Faster Production
Path 2.description: Increases production rate even more.
Path 2.effect: Produces spikes +33% faster (0.75x attack cooldown).

Path 2.name: MOAB SHREDR
Path 2.description: Super-Hard-Rending-Engine-Driven-Razors shred MOAB-Class Bloons.
Path 2.effect: Spikes deal +7 damage to MOAB-class bloons.

Path 2.name: Spike Storm
Path 2.description: Spike Storm ability: Shoots out a thick layer of spikes over the entire track.
Path 2.effect: Ability produces a wave of exactly 200 spike piles over the entire track. Storm spikes last for around 10 seconds, 20 with Long Reach. Smart Spikes upgrade modifies behavior of the spike locations to target only active lanes.

Path 2.name: Carpet of Spikes
Path 2.description: Regularly sets a carpet of spikes over the whole track.
Path 2.effect: Every 15 seconds, produces an automatic Spike Storm. Spikes also deal incredible damage to bloons and MOAB-class, gains increased pierce, attack speed and range for main attack, and storm spikes last for around 20 seconds instead of 10 (40 instead of 20 with Long Reach).

Path 3.name: Long Reach
Path 3.description: Increases range for spike pile drops, plus piles last longer.
Path 3.effect: Increases tower radius by 8, and ordinary spike piles last for 100 seconds instead of 50 seconds. Spike Storm ability spikes last for 100% longer, for an average of 20 seconds instead of 10, or 40 seconds for Carpet of Spikes ability spikes. Increases explosion blast radius of Spiked Mines and Super Mines (main explosion in Super Mines' case) by 33%.

Path 3.name: Smart Spikes
Path 3.description: Spike Factory gains special targeting priority and accelerated production at the start of each round.
Path 3.effect: Gains the Close, Far, and Smart target priorities. In addition, attacks 4x faster for the first 3s of a round. Spike Storm ability spikes land only on lanes that are being used by Bloons in that particular round.

Path 3.name: Long Life Spikes
Path 3.description: Spikes last much longer and can carry over one round.
Path 3.effect: Spikes last for 140 seconds instead of 100 seconds, and spike piles last for 2 active rounds (can carry over 1 round).

Path 3.name: Deadly Spikes
Path 3.description: Extra deadly spikes can pop through 3 layers per spike and last another round.
Path 3.effect: Spike damage increased from 1 to 3, and total active rounds for spike piles increased from 2 to 3.

Path 3.name: Perma-Spike
Path 3.description: High damage spikes become almost permanent.
Path 3.effect: Spike piles have 10 damage per spike, 50 pierce per spike pile, total active rounds increased from 3 to 4, and lasts for 300 seconds instead of 140. Reduces production speed to every 6.06s, but increases start-of-round duration to 10s.

Monkey Village.name: Monkey Village
Monkey Village.cost: Cost Default: $1,020 ( Easy ) $1,200 ( Medium ) $1,295 ( Hard ) $1,470 ( Impoppable ) Flat Pack Buildings : $1,000 (Easy) $1,175 (Medium) $1,270 (Hard) $1,410 (Impoppable)
Monkey Village.abilities: Activated Ability(s) Call to Arms Homeland Defense
Monkey Village.targeting: Targeting Options None, can use basic targeting priorities ( First , Last , Close , Strong ) via Primary Expertise
Monkey Village.attackspeed: Attack Speed Moderately Slow (every 2.5s) [only attacks when upgraded to 5xx]
Monkey Village.towerboosts: Tower Boosts Base: 10% range increase for all monkeys in radius. Jungle Drums (2-x-x) 15% attack speed increase for all monkeys in radius.Radar Scanner (x-2-x) Grants camo detection to all monkeys in radius.Monkey Intelligence Bureau (x-3-x) Allows all monkeys in radius to pop all bloon types.
Monkey Village.related_towers: Monkey Beacon (Tower) , for the predecessor of Monkey Village Monkey Village (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Monkey Village (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Bigger Radius
Path 1.description: Increases influence radius of the village.
Path 1.effect: Influence radius of the Monkey Village increases by +8, for a total of +20% when given to a base Village.

Path 1.name: Jungle Drums
Path 1.description: Increases attack speed of all Monkeys in the radius.
Path 1.effect: All towers in the radius of the Village attack +18% faster (0.85x attack cooldown).

Path 1.name: Primary Training
Path 1.description: All Primary Monkeys in radius get more range, pierce and projectile speed.
Path 1.effect: All Primary Monkeys in the radius of the Village gain +10% further range, +1 pierce, and around +25% projectile speed.

Path 1.name: Primary Mentoring
Path 1.description: All Primary Monkeys in radius get tier 1 upgrades for free, increased range and reduced ability cooldowns.
Path 1.effect: In addition to Primary Training buffs, all Primary Monkeys in the radius of the Village gain a further +5 additive range, reduces ability cooldowns by 10%, and free Tier 1 upgrades.

Path 1.name: Primary Expertise
Path 1.description: Adds Mega Ballista attack, plus all Primary Monkeys in radius get more popping power, ability cooldowns reduced further and tier 1 and 2 upgrades for free.
Path 1.effect: In addition to Primary Mentoring buffs, all Primary Monkeys in the radius of the Village gain +3 pierce instead of +1 pierce, free Tier 1 and 2 upgrades, and -20% ability cooldowns. Main Village gains a further +8 influence range and now regularly shoots homing Mega Ballista blades that deal 10 damage or 200 versus Ceramics and MOAB-class, and pierces up to 100 bloons.

Path 2.name: Grow Blocker
Path 2.description: Prevents Regrow Bloons from working while in the radius of the Village.
Path 2.effect:
All bloons within range of the Village have their Regrow properties
grow-blocked
.

Path 2.name: Radar Scanner
Path 2.description: Allows all Monkeys in the radius to attack Camo Bloons.
Path 2.effect:
Grants all towers in range
camo detection
.

Path 2.name: Monkey Intelligence Bureau
Path 2.description: The Bureau grants special Bloon popping knowledge, allowing nearby Monkeys to pop all Bloon types.
Path 2.effect:
In addition to camo detection, all towers in the radius of the Village gain the
Normal
damage type. Towers with a lack of targeting of bloon properties also gain the capability to target all bloon properties aside from Ceramics and above.

Path 2.name: Call To Arms
Path 2.description: Call to Arms ability: Gives all monkeys +50% attack speed and pops for a short time.
Path 2.effect: Ability causes all towers to gain +50% attack speed and +50% pierce for 15 seconds.

Path 2.name: Homeland Defense
Path 2.description: Ability now increases attack speed and pops by 100% for all Monkeys for 20 seconds.
Path 2.effect: Ability now increases attack speed by +100% and pierce by +100% for 20 seconds.

Path 3.name: Monkey Business
Path 3.description: Provides 10% discount on all Monkeys and upgrades tier 3 or less purchased in the radius of the Village.
Path 3.effect: Reduces the cost of all towers and upgrades tier 3 or less bought within range of the village by 10%. Does not affect hero leveling costs.

Path 3.name: Monkey Commerce
Path 3.description: An additional 5% discount that can stack with up to 2 other Villages with this upgrade.
Path 3.effect: Further reduces the cost of all towers and upgrades tier 3 or below bought within range of the village by another 5%, for a total cost reduction of 15%. This 5% can stack up to 3 times on any one tower, if that tower is in range of multiple villages with this upgrade, for a total price reduction of 25%.

Path 3.name: Monkey Town
Path 3.description: All Monkeys within the radius of the Monkey Town get extra cash per Bloon pop.
Path 3.effect: All towers within range of the Village gain +50% more cash per pop.

Path 3.name: Monkey City
Path 3.description: Increases influence radius, cash generation in radius, and gives you a free Dart Monkey every round.
Path 3.effect: Increases influence radius by +10, direct cash generation by +20%, and gives a free Dart Monkey every round.

Path 3.name: Monkeyopolis
Path 3.description: Absorbs all nearby Banana Farms and their income, freeing up space for new Monkeys.
Path 3.effect: All Banana Farms within range up to Tier 4 are sacrificed to generate more income based on the monetary cost of the Banana Farm sacrifices, rounded up, at a rate of $200 per $2000 worth of sacrifices. Cost of the upgrade increases additively (+5,000) per Banana Farm within range. Gives a base $1000 per round, resulting in a minimum of $1200 per round.

Engineer Monkey.name: Engineer Monkey
Engineer Monkey.targeting: Targeting Options First , Last , Close , Strong , Manual Targeting with Cleansing Foam or 0-1-4 Bloon Trap
Engineer Monkey.camo: Camo Detection Yes (x-3-x, only decamo via foam)
Engineer Monkey.related_towers: Monkey Engineer (BTD5) , for the BTD5 counterpart Engineer Monkey (BTDB2) , for the BTDB2 counterpart

Path 1.name: Sentry Gun
Path 1.description: Creates temporary sentry guns and deploys them nearby.
Path 1.effect: Produces temporary sentry guns onto nearby land. Sentry Guns pop up to 2 bloons per shot, lasts for up to 25 seconds before disappearing, and can be improved with crosspathing.

Path 1.name: Faster Engineering
Path 1.description: Increased efficiency allows the Engineer to produce sentries, foam and bloon traps more often.
Path 1.effect: Produces all contraptions +66% faster (0.60x attack cooldown).

Path 1.name: Sprockets
Path 1.description: Increases sentry gun and Engineer attack speed.
Path 1.effect: Nailgun and newly deployed sentry guns attack twice as fast.

Path 1.name: Sentry Expert
Path 1.description: Sentries deploy with different damage types based on your need.
Path 1.effect: Replaces all new sentries with four specialized sentries: Crushing, Boom, Cold, and Energy. Adjusts deployment of these four sentry types depending on bloons on the screen.

Path 1.name: Sentry Champion
Path 1.description: Creates super-powerful but highly unstable sentries.
Path 1.effect: Replaces all new sentries with powerful plasma sentries that shoot plasma 15 times per second that have 5 pierce and 3 damage. The sentries can pop Frozen and Lead but cannot pop Camo or Purple. Expired sentries now explode a wave of plasma after 25 seconds or when sold, instead of disappearing.

Path 2.name: Larger Service Area
Path 2.description: Shoots further and deploys sentries in a much larger area. Sentries have longer range
Path 2.effect: Engineer gains +20 range and any newly deployed sentries gain +4 range. Allow newly placed selectable placement for Bloon Traps.

Path 2.name: Deconstruction
Path 2.description: Nail gun and Sentry shots do extra damage to MOAB-class and Fortified Bloons.
Path 2.effect: Nailgun and newly deployed sentries deal +1 damage to MOAB-class and +1 damage to Fortified.

Path 2.name: Cleansing Foam
Path 2.description: Sprays foam that removes Camo and Regrow and pops Lead Bloons.
Path 2.effect: Sprays foam anywhere on nearby bloon track. Bloons that hit the foam will permanently lose Camo and Regrow properties. Popping the lead layer to any passing Lead Bloons. In addition, attacks 4x faster for the first 1 seconds of a round. If crosspathed with Sentry Gun, sentries shoot foamy nails that apply foam effect on hit bloons. If crosspathed with Pin, foam slows every non-blimp bloon by 50%.

Path 2.name: Overclock
Path 2.description: Overclock Ability: Target another tower to supercharge its attack speed for a short time.
Path 2.effect: Ability temporarily increases attack speed of tower, range of a Monkey Village, or production of a Banana Farm. Ability duration depends on tier of the selected tower. Main attacks gains more pierce.

Path 2.name: Ultraboost
Path 2.description: Ultra-Overclocked Monkeys gain a small but permanent boost every time they are overclocked.
Path 2.effect: Ability now permanently applies a 10th of the bonus of Overclock onto the selected tower, stacking up to 10 times. Ability cooldown reduced to 35 seconds. Main attack gains even more pierce.

Path 3.name: Oversize Nails
Path 3.description: Massivization allows nails to pop 8 Bloons at once, including frozen. Also increases Foam and Sentry
Path 3.effect:
iveness.
Effect:
Nailgun pierce increases from 3 to 8. Pierce of regular sentries increased from 2 to 3 and foam increased from 10 to 15.

Path 3.name: Pin
Path 3.description: Pins Bloons in place for a short time when struck.
Path 3.effect: Nailgun nails pin any non-blimp bloon other than Leads and Ceramics. Can give Pin effect to sentries with Sprockets or above. Also lets Cleansing Foam slow down any non-blimp bloons.

Path 3.name: Double Gun
Path 3.description: Two guns for twice the fun.
Path 3.effect: Double nailgun attack speed and newly formed sentry guns shoot double projectiles, with the second projectile having 1 pierce.

Path 3.name: Bloon Trap
Path 3.description: Bloon trap captures Bloons until full. Select to empty full trap for cash.
Path 3.effect: Produces a Bloon Trap that captures up to 500 RBE worth of non-blimp bloons. The full trap earns a bonus +100% income compared to popping them normally. Bloon Traps can only trap bloons it can target. Middle path crosspath allows traps to be manually adjusted, autocollecting them.

Path 3.name: XXXL Trap
Path 3.description: Huge Bloon traps can trap some of the largest Bloons in them...
Path 3.effect: Produces a huge XXXL Bloon Trap that captures up to 10,000 RBE worth of all bloon excluding BADs, Bosses, and undetected Camo. There is a 2 second cooldown between each trap that starts when placed. Manually collecting the full trap earns a bonus +100% compared to popping them normally. Only one XXXL trap can be on screen at any time per player.

Beast Handler.name: Beast Handler
Beast Handler.unlocked: Unlocked at Popping 3,000,000 ( Bloons ), " Unlock By Pops " selection, Level 30
Beast Handler.abilities: Activated Ability(s) T Rex Stomp Giganotosaurus Stomp
Beast Handler.targeting: Targeting Options First , Last , Close , Strong Beast targeting ( Place Beast ) Merge (when multiple Beast Handlers combine with their beasts to upgrade)
Beast Handler.camo: Camo Detection Yes (x-x-2, or x-4-x ability)

Path 1.name: Piranha
Path 1.description: Command a small but feisty little fish to leap from the water at the Bloons.
Path 1.effect:
Beast Handler:
Requires water terrain within tower range to be purchasable. Summons a Piranha that leaps at Bloons within range. Can reposition the beast to a valid water location at a cooldown of 2s. Has 1 base Beast Power and 1 max Beast Power.
Piranha:
Leaps onto bloons within range and bites them. Bites 1 target every 0.6s.

Path 1.name: Barracuda
Path 1.description: The Barracuda slaps Bloons backwards and pops multiple layers with their razor sharp teeth. Base Beast Power increased to 3 and max Beast Power becomes 6. Bonus of 2 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Path 1.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Piranha into a Barracuda.
Barracuda:
Bites multiple bloons and pushes Bloons back slightly. Deals 2 damage, 4 pierce, and range increased to 30 (from 25), with a biting radius of 8. At max power, has 4 damage and 10 pierce, plus much more attack speed.

Path 1.name: Great White
Path 1.description: The Great White will crush Bloons, including Lead Bloons in its jaws, dragging them back to the water if needed. At max Beast Power the Great White can drag down MOABs.
Path 1.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Barracuda into a Great White Shark. Base Beast Power becomes 8, max Beast Power increased to 24. Bonus of 5 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Great White:
Great White latches onto any bloon target for upwards of 3 seconds, dragging it into the water if Ceramic or below. It thrashes its tail while doing so, repeatedly dealing splash damage. Attacks knock-back bloons and slow MOAB-Class, apart from BADs and bosses. Range increased from 30 to 40, splash radius of 15, hurls itself every 1.1s and splashes every 0.55s, the splash dealing 12 damage and 10 pierce. At max power, splash deals 24 damage and 30 pierce plus a much faster rate, and the Great White gains the capability to drag down MOABs (only with 1,000,000 RBE or less).

Path 1.name: Orca
Path 1.description: The mighty Orca's huge mouth can grab and drag all but the very largest Bloons into the depths. At max Beast Power the Orca can drag down ZOMGs.
Path 1.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Great White into an Orca. 16 base power, 64 max power. Bonus of 8 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Orca:
The Orca can drag down MOABs and BFBs (with 1,000,000 RBE or less) by default. Splash deals 30 damage over 24 radius, knocks back bloons and blimps harder, and pierce of 20 at the same attack speed as the predecessor, and range increased to 40. At max power, splash has 90 damage and 60 pierce, and Orca gains the capability to drag down ZOMGs and visible DDTs (only with 1,000,000 RBE or less).

Path 1.name: Megalodon
Path 1.description: A truly colossal shark with a taste for Bloon. Requires 3 additional Orca Handlers to control.
Path 1.effect:
Beast Handler:
3 other Orca Handlers are required to be merged with this tower for the upgrade to be purchasable. Transforms the Orca into a Megalodon. Base Beast Power becomes 84 (down to 36 if Orca Handlers are sold), with a minimum of 36 power and max of 132 power. Bonus of 20 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Megalodon:
Megalodon can drag down all non-Boss MOAB-Class Bloons (with 1,000,000 RBE or less), including BADs. Splash radius increased to 32 and range to 50, and can knockback MOAB-class with their 50% speed. Default Megalodon has 1,400 splash damage, 70 pierce, and ???s splash cooldown. Max Beast Power deals 2,100 damage and 90 pierce, and ???s splash cooldown.

Path 2.name: Microraptor
Path 2.description: Command a sharp clawed little dinosaur.
Path 2.effect:
Beast Handler:
Summon a Microraptor onto nearby land. Can reposition the beast to a valid land location at a cooldown of 2s. Has 1 base Beast Power and 1 max Beast Power.
Microraptor:
Attacks bloons with its claws, deals 1 damage, attacks every 1.0s, and has 5 pierce and 20 range.

Path 2.name: Adasaurus
Path 2.description: The sharp teeth of Adasaurus deal high short range damage that can tear through Lead.
Path 2.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Microraptor into an Adasaurus. Base Beast Power increased to 3 and max Beast Power becomes 6. Bonus of 2 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Adasaurus:
Adasaurus can pop Frozen and Lead Bloons. 3 damage, 8 pierce, and 1.0s attack speed. Max Beast Power becomes 6, with 6 damage, 20 pierce, and 0.6561s attack speed.

Path 2.name: Velociraptor
Path 2.description: Velociraptor viciously slashes and chomps, dealing more damage to stunned Bloons.
Path 2.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Adasaurus into a Velociraptor. Base Beast Power becomes 8, max Beast Power increased to 24. Bonus of 5 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Velociraptor:
Velociraptor deals more damage to stunned Bloons. Bites deal 9 damage, 14 pierce, 1.0s attack speed, and 24 range. At max power, 27 damage, 36 pierce and 0.6561s attack speed.

Path 2.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
Path 2.description: The Tyrannosaurus Rex's huge jaw and sharp teeth deal a ton of damage with each bite. T Rex Stomp ability: Stuns up to ZOMG Bloons in a wide area.
Path 2.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Velociraptor into a Tyrannosaurus Rex. 16 base power, 64 max power. Bonus of 8 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Tyrannosaurus:
Bite deals 26 damage, 8 bonus damage to stunned bloons, 24 pierce, and 30 range. Max Beast Power improves to 78 damage, 25 bonus damage to stunned bloons, 55 pierce, and damage carries over from MOAB-class to their children. Gains Stomp ability which stuns up to 400 bloons within range, including ZOMGs and DDTs, for 6 seconds, dealing 150 damage, and has a 40s cooldown. At max Beast Power, ability deals 214 damage, stuns up to 436 bloons, reduces cooldown to 17.5s, and damage and stun carry over from MOAB-class to their children.

Path 2.name: Giganotosaurus
Path 2.description: The biggest and most fierce dinosaur of them all, Giganotosaurus can shred almost any Bloon instantly and with ease. Stomp ability hits the whole map and lasts longer. Requires 3 additional Tyrannosaurus Handlers to control.
Path 2.effect:
Beast Handler:
3 other Tyrannosaurus Handlers are required to be merged with this tower for the upgrade to be purchasable. Transforms the T-Rex into a Giganotosaurus. Base Beast Power becomes 84 (down to 36 if Tyrannosaurus Handlers are sold), with a minimum of 36 power and max of 132 power. Bonus of 20 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Giganotosaurus:
Bites deal significantly greater damage but at a slower rate, range improved to 50, and ignores Line of Sight. Default Giganotosaurus's bite deals 1150 damage, 1533 damage against stunned bloons, 105 pierce, 1.08s attack speed. Max Beast Power improves its bites to deal 1550 damage, 2066 damage against stunned bloons, 150 pierce, and damage carries over from MOAB-class to their children. Stomp ability now hits entire map, deals 550 damage and stuns up to 645 bloons for 12 seconds (6s for MOABs, 4s for BFBs, and 3s for ZOMGs and DDTs), and has a 25s cooldown. At max Beast Power, ability deals 950 damage, pierce is 645, and cooldown is 17.5s.

Path 3.name: Gyrfalcon
Path 3.description: Command a noble little bird of prey that can grab and move Bloons to the drop-off target. Bloons up-track of the target get scratched.
Path 3.effect:
Beast Handler:
Requires track within tower range to be purchasable. Summons a gyrfalcon that flies within range of the Beast Handler's handling range. Reposition point controls pickup of bloons versus simply damaging the bloons on the spot. Has 1 base Beast Power and 1 max Beast Power.
Gyrfalcon:
Flies towards bloons within range, which does 1 damage and carries up to 3 Bloons partway towards the entrance with its claws. Cannot carry Lead, Ceramic, or MOAB-class Bloons. If target(s) are further along the track than the reposition point, picks the targets up, otherwise just pecking them. Deals +1 Regrow damage. Caught bloons only spawn one child.

Path 3.name: Horned Owl
Path 3.description: The Horned Owl is strong enough to grab Ceramic Bloons, and has keen eyes that can detect Camo Bloons.
Path 3.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Gyrfalcon into a Horned Owl. Base Beast Power increased to 3 and max Beast Power becomes 6. Bonus of 2 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Horned Owl:
Can detect camo and pick up more bloons within a wider region. Can pick up Leads (if given Lead-popping) equal to pierce minus one; Fortified Leads consume 2 pierce each and Ceramics consume 6. Deals 1 damage, 6 pierce and 0.7s attack speed. At max power, 2 damage and 18 pierce.

Path 3.name: Golden Eagle
Path 3.description: The Golden Eagle's huge talons make it an expert at grabbing large numbers of Bloons at once.
Path 3.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Horned Owl into a Golden Eagle. Base Beast Power becomes 8, max Beast Power increased to 24. Bonus of 5 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Golden Eagle:
Picks many more bloons and more efficiency at picking up heavier bloons. Lead (if given Lead-popping) consumes only 1 pierce (from 2) and Ceramic consumes 2 (from 6). Deals 1 damage and 30 pierce. At max power, deals 3 damage, 90 pierce, and the capability to pick up MOABs that consume an arbitrarily high pierce. Birds can overflow on pierce, so it can pick up a single MOAB and then nothing else.

Path 3.name: Giant Condor
Path 3.description: The huge talons of the fearsome Giant Condor can pick up smaller MOAB-Class Bloons.
Path 3.effect:
Beast Handler:
Transforms the Golden Eagle into a Giant Condor. 16 base power, 64 max power. Bonus of 8 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Giant Condor:
Can pick up smaller MOAB-class bloons, and MOABs consume 15 pierce. Can pick up to BFBs, which consume 30 pierce. If Lead properties are countered, Condors can grab DDTs, which consume 30 pierce. Deals 2 damage, 13 MOAB-class damage, and 30 pierce. Max Beast Power deals 6 damage, 23 MOAB-class damage, and 90 pierce.

Path 3.name: Pouākai
Path 3.description: The legendary Pouākai, a bird so large that it can pick up, carry off and destroy almost any number of Bloons of almost any size. Requires 3 additional Condor Handlers to control.
Path 3.effect:
Beast Handler:
3 other Condor Handlers are required to be merged with this tower for the upgrade to be purchasable. Transforms the Giant Condor into a Pouākai. Base Beast Power becomes 84 (down to 36 if Condor Handlers are sold), with a minimum of 36 power and max of 132 power. Bonus of 20 Beast Power compared to predecessor.
Pouākai:
Picks up many more bloons in a massive region and affects any type of bloon. No longer consumes extra pierce versus Ceramics. Can naturally pop Lead and pick up ZOMGs, which consume 60 pierce. BADs and Bosses can be hit and damaged but not picked up. Default Pouakai deals 50 damage, 130 MOAB-class damage, and 300 pierce. At max Beast Power, deals 90 damage, 170 MOAB-class damage, and 450 pierce.
